snippet: Lt. Gen. Abdul Raziq has effectively checked the insurgents while being accused of human rights abuses, presenting Afghanistan’s new president with a dilemma.
abstract: Lt Gen Abdul Raziq, police chief of Kandahar, Afghanistan, has effectively stopped insurgent attacks in the city but also faces accusations of human rights abuses; his contradictory actions present complex choice for Pres Ashraf Ghani, who must balance his stated aim to sweep out Karzai-era strongmen while maintaining security in face of sustained Taliban assault.

byline.contributor: Zia ur-Rehman contributed reporting from Chaman, Pakistan.

lead_paragraph: Lt. Gen. Abdul Raziq has effectively checked the insurgents while being accused of human rights abuses, presenting Afghanistan’s new president with a dilemma.

headline.main: Powerful Afghan Police Chief Puts Fear in Taliban and Their Enemies
headline.print_headline: Powerful Afghan Police Chief Puts Fear in Taliban and Their Enemies
